Brodeur (Embroiderer), Section 18, Plate 1, Encyclopédie, ou dictionnaire raisonné des sciences, des arts et des métiers (Encyclopedia, or Systematic Dictionary of the Sciences, Arts, and Trades), vol.19

label: Description
value: Drawing divided into two registers. In top register, a scene of two women weaving fabric in a room. On the left, a woman weaves at a loom and looks out at the viewer. The woman on the right sits at a table looking at fabric patterns. In the bottom register, depictions of tools and embroidery patterns labeled with figure numbers.

label: Provenance
value: Kubler Collection (Transferred from Cooper Union Picture Library); 1949: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: A depiction of the various tools used by embroiderers and patterns for stitched knots. Each is labeled with a figure number.

Tailleur d'Habits, outils, from Diderot's Encyclopaedia

label: Description
value: Drawing divided into two registers. On top, a view of a tailor shop. On far left bottom, a man crouched under a table irons clothing. Seated on a table, four women sew clothing. At right, a tailor takes a man's measurements. Far right, a man cuts fabric. In the bottom register, depictions of the tools used by tailors, all given figure labels.

label: Dimensions
value: 35.6 x 22.6 cm (14 in. x 8 7/8 in.), irregular

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

Plate XXXII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Two small boats pulling a larger one through a channel. Teams of horses hitched to masts of the small boats; the small boats with ropes to the large boat. Bridge, lower left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-229.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXXIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Plow pulled by two oxen hitched also to two ropes, a woodem frame at either end and a hand turned axel on the plow on which are three men. Houses, upper left, a town, upper left. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-230.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXXIV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Cut-away view of two floors of a building. Upper left, a horse hitched to a machine for pulling large heavy blocks (of marble?) into the building on the floor below.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXV from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Pulley system for raising buckets of bricks on a pipe to the top of the wall, masonry. Seven men at work. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-232.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXXVI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for transferring liquids from ships to the shore. Large buckets with spigots at either end of pipes on a screw. Worked by one man on a platform beneath. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-233.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXVII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Machien for transferring solid objects from ships to the shore. Boat right, with man. Solid pyramid in chains above, on a crane-like frame run by a man, lower left. With a lever and weights. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-234.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate XXXVIII from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
value: Crame for transferring solid objects from the ship to shore: water, at  left; boat with columns. Two men turn a screw on a platform that moves the crane. Description in Latin on verso of 1949-152-235.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line

Plate XXXIX from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line

Plate XLI from Theatrum instrumentorum et machinarum

label: Description
